Posts.Content: LBBC_Jenna wrote: Join Living Beyond Breast Cancer for its annual fall conference, News You Can Use: Breast Cancer Updates for Living Well, from 9:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. on Saturday, November 13, 2010, at the Loews Philadelphia Hotel in Center City. Learn about cutting-edge treatments for early-stage and metastatic breast cancer, hear how to get involved in research to better help diverse groups of women, understand how to enhance your quality of life using medical and complementary methods, find out how to minimize side effects, get advice on how to cope with your emotional concerns, and connect with speakers, exhibitors and other women and caregivers. Travel grants and fee waivers are available. For more information, visit http://www.lbbc.org/ or call 610-645-4567. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Philadelphia Area Conference - Featuring Dr. Weiss LBBC_Jenna LBBC_Jenna

Posts.Content: LBBC_Jenna wrote: At stage IV, metastatic disease is known for being so invasive that it spreads to the bones, lungs, liver, and the brain. Although there is no cure for this stage of breast cancer, there are ways to explore that can help you live well. Join Living Beyond Breast Cancer (LBBC) for our free national teleconference and metastatic breast cancer series, Living Well with Metastatic Breast Cancer. Both segments will inform women about the latest treatments used to manage metastatic disease and the consequential side effects that are associated with the treatment with expert medical perspectives from Lidia Schapira, MD and Steven D. Passick, PhD.Â To register, visit http://www.lbbc.org/ or call 610 645 4567. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: *FREE* Teleconference for Women with Metastatic Breast Cancer LBBC_Jenna MJLToday
